revised_title: Initiation and Growth of Explosion in Solids: A Discussion on Ultrasonic Radiation and Oxidation
tldr: This article discusses the initiation and growth of explosions in solid mixtures, specifically focusing on the oxidation induced by ultrasonic radiation in a system of lauryl aldehyde and potassium chlorate. The authors found that the degree of oxidation is directly related to the intensity of the ultrasonic radiation, and they propose a hypothesis that high temperatures are produced at certain favored spots, leading to the oxidation of the aldehyde.
